You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins", followed by the list of Parameter Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

message.content:
Now I have all the information needed to generate the parameter objects for the PUT endpoint `/admin/posts/{post}`. Let me analyze what I found:

1. **Path Parameter**: `{post}` - This is the route parameter that identifies which post to update
2. **Request Body Parameters**: Based on the PostsRequest validation rules, the request body should contain:
   - `title` (required)
   - `content` (required) 
   - `posted_at` (required, date format)
   - `author_id` (required, exists in users table)
   - `thumbnail_id` (optional, exists in media table)
   - `slug` (unique, auto-generated from title)

For the OpenAPI specification of a PUT endpoint, I need to define:
- The path parameter `{post}`
- The request body with all the expected fields

Let me think about the structure:

1. Path parameter: `post` (in path, required)
2. Request body: application/json with the fields from the validation rules

the final generated result begins
```json
[
  {
    "name": "post",
    "in": "path",
    "description": "The post ID",
    "required": true,
    "type": "integer",
    "format": "int64"
  },
  {
    "name": "body",
    "in": "body",
    "description": "Post update data",
    "required": true,
    "schema": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "title": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "The title of the post",
          "example": "Sample Post Title"
        },
        "content": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "The content of the post",
          "example": "This is the content of the post..."
        },
        "posted_at": {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "date-time",
          "description": "The date and time when the post was posted",
          "example": "2023-12-01T10:00:00Z"
        },
        "author_id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "format": "int64",
          "description": "The ID of the author",
          "example": 1
        },
        "thumbnail_id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "format": "int64",
          "description": "The ID of the thumbnail media",
          "example": 1
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "title",
        "content",
        "posted_at",
        "author_id"
      ]
    }
  }
]
```
